text.text: How do I identify a provider take back in the imported remit?

text: A provider take back is a pending take back in the status of " Follow - up- Take back pending ".

text.text: What information is included in the PLB segment of a remit indicating a take back?

text: The PLB segment information displays under the " Provider Adjustment " heading. You will see the PLB amount (amount they are taking back), the reason code such as forward balance (FB), and an identifier. The PLB segment is linked to the claim for which the payment was originally applied.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the "Ready to post" section in the imported remit?

text: The "Ready to post" section is where you can edit imported remittance credit amounts that have not yet been posted. You can also edit the next payer and status block on the Line-item Editor page.

text.text: What options do I have when dealing with a provider take back in Zoll Billing?

text: You can cut a refund check for the full amount of the take back or deal with a reduced amount on a future remit check from this payer.

text.text: How can I determine if a claim has a pending take back after posting the transaction?

text: The status of the claim associated with the take back will be "Follow-up-Take back pending". You can also see the denial information, which includes the dial code and denial explanation.

text.text: What information do I need to provide when resolving a provider take back with a refund?

text:
To resolve a provider take back with a refund, you will need to provide the following information:

* The claim number
* The amount of the take back
* The reason for the take back
* The payer's name and address
* The payer's bank routing number and account number
* The refund check number
* The date the refund check was issued

Once you have provided this information, Zoll Billing will process the refund and send it to the payer.

text.text: How does Zoll Billing handle provider take backs reactively?

text: A provider typically alerts you that they are taking money back by including a PLB segment in the remit file that shows a PLB amount and reason code.

text.text: What happens to the payment of submitted claims when a provider take back is applied reactively?

text: When you import the remit that contains the actual take back, you will see the amount the provider paid for the submitted claims. Under the "Provider adjustments" heading, the PLB amount withheld from the payment displays. For example, an allocated payment of $5,000 would be reduced to $3,000 if the PLB amount was $2,000.

text.text: How do I view the details of a claim after a provider take back has been applied reactively?

text: The status of the claim associated with the take back will be "Follow-up-Take back pending". You can click the Credits tab to see the payment and the pending take back. You can also see the denial information, which includes the dial code and denial explanation.

text.text: What steps are involved in the refund process for resolving a provider take back?

text:
To resolve a provider take back with a refund, you will need to follow these steps:

1. Go to the "Claims" tab and select the claim that has the pending take back.
2. Click the "Refunds" tab and click the "Create Refund" button.
3. Enter the following information:
    * The claim number
    * The amount of the refund
    * The reason for the refund
    * The payer's name and address
    * The payer's bank routing number and account number
    * The refund check number
    * The date the refund check was issued
4. Click the "Submit" button.

Once you have submitted the refund request, Zoll Billing will process the refund and send it to the payer.

text.text: Where can I find the "Take back reversal" and refund details after resolving a provider take back with a refund?

text: The claim's status changes to "Follow-up-Balance after refund". Under the Credits tab, you will see a "Take back reversal" line item type that indicates that you have reversed the pending take back. This is followed by another block that show the refund amount. You will also see the denial posted. Click the Running Claim Balance tab, to see the payment reversal and the refund.

text.text: Can you guide me through checking the payment reversal and refund under the "Running Claim Balance" tab?

text: The "Running Claim Balance" tab shows the new refund and all other transactions for this claim.

text.text: How can I access the raw data of an imported remit in Zoll Billing?

text: The raw data of an imported remit in Zoll Billing is available in the https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Payment posting / Provider takebacks.htm 1/6 10.

text.text: How can I access the raw data of an imported remit in Zoll Billing?

text: The raw data of an imported remit in Zoll Billing is available in the.

text.text: How do I view the line item details in the remit for a specific entry?

text: To see the line item in the remit for the entry, click the View CLP link on the same line as the item.

text.text: What steps are involved in accessing the denial information associated with a claim in Zoll Billing?

text: To access the denial information associated with a claim in Zoll Billing, you can click the Full denial button.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the "Provider Adjustment" section in the imported remit?

text: The provider adjustments section in the imported remit shows the provider paid, expected payment, charge amount, interest, claim number, and service date.

text.text: what is take back?

text: A take back is when an insurance provider withholds payment because of a previous overpayment or incorrect payment. This is called a take back because the insurance provider is taking back the money they paid.

text.text: What is Proactive – resolve with a refund?

text: Proactive - resolve with a refund is when you realize an overpayment, cut a refund check, and send it to the payer.

text.text: How to issue a take back refund?

text: To issue a take back refund, you can click the Credits tab and then click Resolve with a refund.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=vxgne0ru62

text.text: How to find take backs?

text: To find take backs, you can look for remits with PLB segments. The PLB segment information displays under the "Provider Adjustment" heading. You will see the PLB amount (amount they are taking back), the reason code such as forward balance (FB), and an identifier.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=5nriaiwzul
